Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Jim, Jim. Come here. [holds up photo] Do you know who that is?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at him. Look at him - t-shirt, jeans...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is he you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] I am flattered. That's Johnny Depp.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where did you take that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In my condo complex.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God, that's right. I read in People magazine that he was looking for a two-bedroom condo in Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am flipping out, man. I mean, you remember my idea for the fourth Pirates movie.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure. That they should do one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [feigning accent] Hey, Jim, Jim - where, where do I find the Black Pearl?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who's that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Captain Jack Sparrow. Captain Jack Sparrow, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: John Dillinger.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I'm Captain Jack Sparrow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Captain Crunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. Screw you, Halpert. You know, it's not easy getting excited about stuff. Remember how you felt when you thought you'd seen Roger Clemens?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: At the Yankees game. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Well, it wasn't him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I had a little better reason to believe that... You're right. You're right. Well, you're not right, because Johnny Depp...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: ...in your condo complex.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know! It also explains why the name on his mailbox was M Shulman.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: M. Night Shulman?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [speaking at a staff meeting] First up, the lost and found has gone missing. It itself is lost, so please, try not to lose anything until we find it. Ah, pet day. If you don't have a pet, please don't feel like -

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: When are we getting to sales topics?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, what about those leads? Did you hear anything from corporate?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, yes, the leads. The leads that Sabre has spent $50,000 to get from a market research company... are not here yet. But will be.. [muttering, people rise to leave] No, no, meeting's not over.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: But is there anything relevant to the sales staff here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No sales topic per se.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well then no Andy Bernard per se. [Andy and others begin exiting the room]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sorry, Michael, I got calls to make.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would like your undivided attention, please.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You couldn't handle my undivided attention.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Over the last few weeks, things have been changing here. Sabre says it is our duty to support the sales team and the salesmen are letting it go to their heads. I think it's kind of screwed up, because the way this place used to work was:

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen, Michael - about what happened earlier.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When I was asking about the leads.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: M-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ... is there any news on the leads?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is that all you have to say to me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. You got any news on the leads? ... Okay, I'll tell you what. I'm going out on a very important sales call. You get any news about the leads, you try me. All of my numbers. All six of my numbers, okay? Including the car phone! [leaves office] Alright, Dwight out!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Salesman is king. As the best salesman, I am king of kings. Oh, you say Jesus is king of kings? Well. What does that say to you about how I think of myself?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hm-hm. Do you not answer e-mails anymore? Because I've e-mailed you four times asking you to come to my desk.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Honey, if I don't have time to answer an e-mail, I definitely don't have time to walk over to your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, wowie wowie. Congratulations. It's a big cheque. [Jim stands in corner, texting]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, sorry, wait one second.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop sexting Pam. I'm trying to congratulate you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is actually a big potential sale, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You writing your memoirs over there?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You writing your name over there?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it's a pretty big check.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's good. You know, with the kid.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Don't gloat. Here's the thing. This kind of money can corrupt people.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, here we go. [taps page] Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm just saying, that -

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael - [Michael signs] Great.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on phone] Very nice. Let me just, let me just write that down real quick. [motions to Darryl] Pencil? Can you give me that pencil? Hang on Teddy... [covers phone] I'm making a sale. Sales.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: There's other pencil's in this office.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Give me that [wrestles with Darryl, Andy falls over chair and to the floor]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Honey and jelly sandwich time. [removes lunch from fridge]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you got to be kidding me. [holds up squashed sandwich] Look at that. That's -

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I know who did that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You saw who did this and you didn't stop them?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Didn't have to see. It was sales. I can feel it. They are out of control.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The sales department smashed my sandwich.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes. All of 'em. Together. It's a conspiracy. Listen to me, Mike, you gotta do something about them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't get it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You need to get back on top.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what she said.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Something came for you, Michael. [hands him a parcel]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What'd you get?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, just the stupid leads.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: About time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Me likey!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Finally, Michael. Hand 'em over, numbnuts. [Michael stares at her incredulously] But seriously. It's your job to give us those leads.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. Then I guess I should give them out. Hold on. You know what I'm thinking? I'm thinking that I have something that you want. You guys are acting like you own this place. And you don't. Not even Sabre owns this place. It's a rental. I'm kind of sick of the attitude around here. I'm sick of the cocky walk, I am sick of you throwing your paycheck in my face, I am sick of your uppity attitude, Jim... I think I am not going to give these to you. [Angela, Kevin and Oscar applaud]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We need those leads, Michael. It's our job Michael. Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [on phone] Michael, we spent a lot of money on those leads. You have to give them out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Then we are just rewarding their bad behaviour. Okay. Just - imagine that instead of going to jail for murdering someone, you got an ice-cream cone. If that were the case, then in the summertime, everyone would go around killing people for the pleasure of an ice-cream cone.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Michael, I don't want to incentivise murder. But - we've tried to make it clear that our policy emphasises sales staff -

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They act like I have no power.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: But you do. You are in charge -

Quote.Speaker: Miichael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: - of supporting the sales staff. You are required to hand out those leads, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm. Well, if that is what I am required to do, I will do exactly that.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay, good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Exactly that.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Exactly that.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Why do you keep repeating - [Michael hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello. May I have everyone's attention, please? Gabe has instructed me to hand out the leads, so I'm going to give the leads to... King Creed! [hands him a lead]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What are you -

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: - and to King Meredith! [hands her a lead]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: They aren't salespeople!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And to King Angela! [hands her a lead] Because today we are all kings. And queens [pats Oscar's shoulder].

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What the hell do you think you're doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm giving them the leads, Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So I'm going to go ahead and save you some time, and tell you that no-one's going to go along with this. But you knew that, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. So why don't you just give me my share of the leads, and I'll start making some calls?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. [passes Jim some index cards]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ahh, these aren't leads. What are they?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, right, those are clues. And within each clue is a lesson. You learn a lesson, and then you find a lead. The leads are scattered all over the industrial park. I am trying to make your kids respect you. Because a father needs to respect his boss, and kids don't respect the father who doesn't respect the boss. Do you understand that line of logic?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't think you understand -

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do understand it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [holds up card] This one's a map.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Or is it?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, how the tables have turned. I see you got my e-mail.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Are you gonna give me the leads or not?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'll give you the leads. But you know what? It's going to cost you some clerical work [hands her a mountain of paperwork]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What are these for?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It doesn't matter. Fill them out. All of them. Then when you're done, you can watch me shred them.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I want to watch the Kardashians! I don't want to watch boring -

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's my -

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: The Kardashians is a good show.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No it's - how would he even know the Kardashians?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's about a family. A real-life family.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, Stanley, do you -

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [over phone] Hey baby, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am currently reading incoherent riddles on blue index cards to find vital information that Michael has hidden all over the office. How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nothing but vomit and diapers over here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my god, I couldn't envy you more.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Having a baby is as exhausting as they say it is. Having two babies [holds up index cards] - that's just unfair.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How about this one - 'When arrogant salesmen are mean to my face, a certain manager will go to his moppy place.'

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He means his mopey place, it's under that streetlamp that he thinks was in Casablanca.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today I turned an office crisis into a teachable moment. [cuts to Jim fishing one of the leads out of a catering size tin of Ravioli] A lesser manager would have screwed this day up royally [clue next to Jim reads:

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey. I guess you probably won't give me your leads since I'm a jerk salesman.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah. I basically wish you were dead. [grins] I hid the leads.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [mimes zipping mouth and throwing away key, Andy begins to walk away] Colder. Colder. Warmer. Warmer. Colder. Colder. Warmer. Warmer. Warmer. Hot. [Andy hovers his hands above her chest] Hotter. Pretty hot. Lower.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Lower.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you sure?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Lower [tilts head toward her desk, then flips over her keyboard, revealing the leads. Andy scratches his head, recovering]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you doing, idiot? [Jim is crouched down, peering under a car]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael's stupid scavenger hunt.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Scavenger hunt? Here. I can solve it. Give it. [grabs card] 'The treasure you seek is in the parking lot under the first president.'

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [taps car] Lincoln.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The prankster is getting pranked. Ha ha.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [holds up the retrieved lead] It involves you too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The leads are in?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael? Michael, you were supposed to tell me when the leads came in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, bigshot, 'If you want to find your leads, go to the man who never breathes'.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kevin! Damnit [runs over to Kevin's desk] Kevin, give me those leads. Where are they? C'mon -

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You are never going to find them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm going to enjoy this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [begins to strangle him] Gimme the leads. Where are my leads?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [muffled] I'm still enjoying it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where are they?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Turn the trash. Turn the trash.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Turn the trash [releases him - Kevin coughs] It's code. Alright, Meredith, take off your dress.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [stands up and reaches for her buttons] Okey-dokey.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, dear god, no, it's in the trash can. In the kitchen.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: It's coming off anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [dashes to kitchen, overturns the trash can, tastes the bin liner] Clean sack.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What -

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I emptied it in the dumpster. With Toby's baba ganoush.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: If we don't patronise the only Syrian restaurant in town, there'll be nothing left but pan pizzas and make-your-own salads.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [dives into dumpster, rattling noises then he emerges] It's empty!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait. What day is today?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Um, tonight is Ghost Whisperer. So, Friday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my god. Oh my god [takes off running] oh my god, no, no no, hey, hey [chases after garbage van] wait, wait!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. You know what, let's just go to the dump, start looking - Ryan, c'mon, shotgun in my car -

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, why would we all go to the dump?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why? Because I am not going to call Sabre and say, 'Hi, you know those very valuable expensive leads that you gave us earlier today? Well, because of a screw-up by a staff member, they're now in the city dump."

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Not your staff, Michael. You.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that's not the way it's going t sound. Here's what we're going to do. We'll go to the dump, we'll look around, then we'll all go out and get pizza, maybe catch a movie, late-night drink, some more pizza, call it a night. What do you -

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Does it have to be pizza? Could go for a, falafel?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm not going. You did this, not us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, no, you encouraged it. You were complicit [looks to Jim for vocab-reassurance] Complicit. You were all successories!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That sounds fun, mucking around in the dump. Wish I could go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I can't. You know that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay fine, I get it. I'll just go by myself.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll go, Michael. You'll just screw it up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [looks around dump] This place has gone to hell.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, Dwight, there was a time when you'd be pinching yourself to have the opportunity to look through a dump with me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, the acorn becomes the oak.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Sometimes the acorn just stays the acorn. If you don't believe me, look in my gutters.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [to Oscar] You're adorable. You need to go for it. [Jim enters the break room] I'm going to be, like, mad at you if you don't -

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Phew! Can't wait for this day to be over.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just all the - drama.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What drama?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Between the - us and you guys. It's unnecessary, right?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So unnecessary.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, good, phew, thank god you said that.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I mean, if the salesmen weren't acting like such a bunch of stuck-up losers, then this day wouldn't be so bad - did you ever think of that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have new baby pictures.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Don't use your cute baby to make us like you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She's wearing a onesie [holds out his cell phone, Oscar leans in but Kelly grabs his arm]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: If we act nice now, then we're rewarding them for treating us poorly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Didn't we kind of start it?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I think you're remembering that wrong?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't know about this. I mean, I think we should hold our ground. The company's changed, and if they don't like it, they can leave. I mean, a lot of their work can be done from India.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can we at least all agree that this is uncomfortable, and may be heading for something bad?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All those who agree, say aye [all present - Stanley, Andy and Phyllis - raise their hands] All those opposed -

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't think we need opposed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [kicking through rubbish at the dump] You've changed, man.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, why, because I have a shot at a $100k commission?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Since when do you care about money? When I first met you, you were a wide-eyed innocent.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. There is nothing I can do about my wide-set eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm talking about your personality, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When I first met you, I had a lot of job offers. And I had an offer from Ivan Schartsky. The Ivan Schartsky. And if I'd assistant managed him -

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Assistant to the managed him -

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, that's low! I would be number two right now at Home Depot!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay? Because they promote from within. Instead I had to follow you - you, going nowhere.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You think you would have done better without me? Really?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I hitched my wagon to a horse with no legs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. Ohhhkay. Man. When I think about all the time I wasted being your friend - I shouldn't have been hanging out watching karate movies with you -

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kung-fu movies!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, I should have been doing? I should have been out at bars, finding my soul-mate, finding my wife, making babies -

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nice babies you're making with the floozies at the bars.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's my wife you're talking about, man.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Your made-up wife? Who doesn't exist? [Michael picks up a piece of metal and hurls it at Dwight, who sidesteps] You watch it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If I wanted to hit you, I would have hit you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't do it [lobs something at Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No no. You just made an enemy with the wrong guy, Dwight. [they throw volleys of rubbish at each other] No, time out, time out. [Michael inspects a box, then hurls it at Dwight] Time in!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! [lunges for a large wooden spool]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't even think about that [Dwight begins rolling it towards Michael, as he reaches him Dwight kicks it and falls backward. The spool comes to a halt in front of Michael, and Michael pushes it towards Dwight.]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [kicks spool] Stop it, get out! That's my spool.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What's the least we can do to make this okay?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll text Pam. She's really good at this stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And I'll text Erin. She's really good at this stuff too.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I guess we could give them some of our new commissions.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That is a dangerous precedent.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam texted back saying we could give them all iPods.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, if they don't have an iPod by now they really don't want one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. Then we're back to cash. And I got to say, if giving a small percentage of our commissions is going to smooth all this over, I'm for it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay, fine. Cash it is.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin just texted me back. 'People love shells from far-away beaches".

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Dwight. Here we go [picks up a sink, spills dump juice on his pants] oh god.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh [half-heartedly throws something]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're never going to find those leads, are we? [they both sit on the edge of a claw-footed bathtub]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [surveys the mountains of trash surrounding them] Wow. Amazing, isn't it. No other animal on earth could do this. Maybe beavers. But not like this.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: So how about, guys, one percent commission a month instead of two, what do you -

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, we agreed, two percent for the quarter. Okay [others enter] Hey everybody!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [stares at the table filled with treats] Nice spread. We get it. You eat like royalty.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no - this is a representation of how we feel. And how we feel is:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This [picks up racquet] Why would somebody throw that out?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey [holds up an old sweater] You know who'd like this? Phyllis. Purple, much?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, she does - she loves purple. [Dwight sniffs it] Does it stink?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah [puts it back in the bath tub]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Know what would be a great picture here? Just this whole dump, and in the middle, one flower. That's it. And the caption would read:

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [drives into office parking lot, honking horn. Enormous purple object strapped to the roof of their car] Woo hoo!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Good news that you found our leads?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! Better!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We have an awesome bean bag chair that's perfect for the break room. [reaches out the window and pats it]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yuck. I'm not going to sit on that disgusting seat.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, damn right you're not. 'Cause it's for me and Michael only [they both cheer and high-five]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [at dump] It's freezing out here.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [strips off jacket] Go on. I have warm blood. [tries to drape her small jacket across Andy's back]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh wow, thank you. You're the nicest person I've ever met. [Andy and Erin kiss]
